page.title: 18Post Office and Stores
page.content: The Post Office at Middlezoy is a small rural sub post office. It is also the village stores. The post office and stores is run by Mr and Mrs R Gilham who took over in 1984. They sell groceries, fresh fruit and vegetables, provisions, toys, sweets, greetings cards, ice-creams and also have a small off-licence department. The shop is open every day, but is closed on Wednesday afternoons. The post office counter is closed on Saturday afternoons and Sundays. There is one delivery of mail each morning except Sunday. The postman comes from Bridgwater by van. Mail is collected from the letter box by the post office at 8 am and 4.45 pm. Most of the villagers have to travel to Bridgwater or even further afield for other shopping requirements.
